Description: Sherd of wheel-made pottery vessel with hand modelled decoration in the form of a head. Unslipped and unglazed. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Similar face is modelled on the front of an askos from Naukratis, found in a context dated c. 300BC (Nottingham, Castle Museum NCM 1888-4). Possibly influenced by Cypriot vessels, see British Museum GR1876,0909.4. However close parallels dated to the 6th and 7th centuries AD are known from the coptic Museum, Cairo and from Berlin.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IE.) (Phase 3)
